column5: You're not gonna drink cold beer with those wings are ya??
You're not gonna drink cold beer with those wings are ya?? Some of us simply inhale
On my way!
Was good to see the old diehards and share a pint or two.  The crowd just keeps getting smaller every year. Pretty soon  we'll be down to a couple of old timers on a park bench with a brown paper bag
Pretty soon  we'll be down to a couple of old timers on a park bench with a brown paper bag  I'll be there Bruce.
Great to see a few old faces and meet some new folks.  Nothing better than getting away from the house and chatting with some great people about fishing, (and the beer, can't forget about the beer )

Great to see a few old faces and meet some new folks.  Nothing better than getting away from the house and chatting with some great people about fishing, (and the beer, can't forget about the beer )  You definitely caught me by surprise Paul, it was indeed good to talk shop as it were with you over a couple of cold ones.

It was great to be with friends (old or new) and hopefully we can get more out next GTG people say we don't meet people, well this is how we get together between Christmas and New Years and get ready for more GTG
Sitting on a park bench with a brown paper bag - I don't have a problem with that!  LOL!   Good to see every one.  It was nice chatting about our favorite hobby!

Just a quick rundown of those in attendance.Bigugli (Bruce and his wife Judy), Wormdunker (Brian), Fish Farmer (Dave), HTHM (Albert), Loonietoon (Kelvin), LeXXington (Paul), Tipwatcher (George) and myself.   It was a very enjoyable afternoon, thanks all.
Too bad I couldn't make it this year..  Not enough time off between Christmas and new years...  Maybe next time
Sorry I missed it. Chose Florida instead. Just got back today. No ice fishing, just fishing for ice for the Crown.
Afternoon is good for me.
Afternoon is good for me.  And I did want to see you get up and sing a little country, Dam Turn you hearing aid down and you won't hear yourself.

We can always meet in the afternoon if fitting for all involved  I will be there around 2.30pm and will see what happens  H O P E   T H I S    W O R K S    F O R   A L B E R T ..... Kelvin, remember what I said about having a self-centered relationship??? I will try to make it.
I plan on being there in the afternoon. Hope to see the regulars. It would be nice to see new faces too. You salsa lovin' guys should put your orders in with Bruce. It went fast last year.
Afternoon works for me, unless the bite is on.
if I have filled my deer tag I will try an make it.

Bump. Looks good for me so far. Is it going to be "The usual suspects" as last year? Who's in so far? I hope some more locals can make it. Bruce is good for 6 or so if he brings all 3 generations of Bruce's'.

See everyone soon... WINGS....YUM YUM..

No Speil I was talking about the first choice. I was happy it was changed and just wanted everyone to know about Art's tragic death. I got all emotional and it went straight to the keyboard. Sorry Kelvin. I'm all calmed down this glorious morning. I hope to make it on the 29th. I really do not enjoy driving at night now, maybe I can talk one of the lake scallywags here to join me. Just this week and it's only Friday 3 Deer crossed my path. Last night a huge Buck jumped out of the ditch and did a 180 when he heard my Deer Gear I bought at the $$ store! No problem John.. I fully understand what was going through you head  :good:if there is anything there to catch it

Yep, I have had several X-rays and MRI's of the noggin over the years. All show nothing. Isn't negative the same as nothin'.  I saw something the other day on one of those silly health reports. A single deep fried chicken wing has no less than,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,ready,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,, 375 calories. I will fast from the 25th, no 26th, wait maybe the 28th until the 29th. I had no idea they were that much. No wonder I can't get under 205 anymore.

Yep, I have had several X-rays and MRI's of the noggin over the years. All show nothing. Isn't negative the same as nothin'.  I saw something the other day on one of those silly health reports. A single deep fried chicken wing has no less than,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,ready,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,, 375 calories. I will fast from the 25th, no 26th, wait maybe the 28th until the 29th. I had no idea they were that much. No wonder I can't get under 205 anymore. Johnny if it makes you feel better 2 pieces is 1 whole wing.
Johnny if it makes you feel better 2 pieces is 1 whole wing.   OMG, Thats a good one newf.
OMG, Thats a good one newf.  Actually a wing has 3 pieces. I guess that's why my survival suit shrunk.
Actually a wing has 3 pieces. I guess that's why my survival suit shrunk.  Ya, the wing tip is for picking yer teeth after. LOL
Johnny, when you mentioned Aacon, is that the actual name? Or is it Aecon?  Just curious

I love the wing tip. I've been pigging out on those babies since I got off strained carrots. Mom is from North Tonawanda NY. I still remember taking the bus to the Saturday market in east Buffalo with Nani and she got wings for free. When they say that the Anchor Bar in Buffalo invented the Buffalo chicken wing I laugh. Maybe they were the first to charge for them. Durkee's hot sauce on wings have been around long before the Anchor Bar served them. When we were babes we could go into bars in the States with Dad and the Uncles and I remember them serving them free like peanuts and there was a bottle of Durkees you smothered them in, this was 1959. My favorite drink at 6 was Birch Beer. Something like Root Beer. I was one of a few Canucks that had a McDonalds burger on the Niagara Falls Boulevard long before we had a Mac's in Canada. They were something like 10 cents each and I could whack out 30 cents worth.
M2B2, you win the spelling bee.
I was curious because Aecon "was" working at New Gold mine(where I work) till they got the steeltoe.

Aecon is a very large contractor, has been for years. They were mostly mechanical construction and maintenance. Some of their Managers though were 25 years behind the times. More like 40 years behind, before the Occupational Health and Safety Act 1978 came into legislation. More than a few times I told a Superintendent or GF, "you can't say that man!" As in "if you don't like it go home." Coming from a place with a highly educated Union workforce I was actually shocked. I couldn't work for them, I hope the culture has changed today.
Nope, hasnt changed one bit!

When you get a chance read one of those little Green paperbacks hanging from a chain on the job site. Most likely for you guys Rick it would be The Ontario Health and Safety Act for Mines and Mining Plants. I know you have, haven't others? Does everyone sleep through WHIMIS? It's all there in black and white. I really couldn't believe what I saw and heard on those sites. It was like going back to the 70's at Stelco. The year I worked as MOL inspector I told my manager most of the construction sites were in violation each and everyday, manufacturing plants were generally compliant. His reply and I adopted it would be "do you fish?" yep, " do you catch them all?"  Oops Hi-Jack alert. This is what we would talk about at the GTG, fishing a bit too. Always the way. Get away fishing with the guys at the plant and talk about what? WORK!!!!

Aecon was basically booted from the site due to violations of the regs.  That and I was shocked at how many of their employees acted. Nothing like welding "tims a good dresser" to the structure of the mill.  They were also notorius for ignoring all road signs on site.  Anyhow yes, back to fishing lol
So where and when is the GTG? State it clearly and simply please. Type slowly so that I don't tire out my lips when reading it.

So where and when is the GTG? State it clearly and simply please. Type slowly so that I don't tire out my lips when reading it. A l b e r t ...i t  i s  t h e  A l e  H o u s e  o n  U p p e r  G a g e  D e c  2 9  a t  7  0 0 p m   Slow enough for you

It sounds like you need a hug big Albert. Many hugs available on the 29th.  I just read a few online reviews about the Ale House, they were all positive. 6 bucks a pound for wings on Tues and Thursdays with a few carrots and celery add a buck. One reviewer didn't think a few veggies were worth a Loonie. We had a customer at the restaurant that would bring a pocket full with him on Wing Night. The strange thing was they were included in a pound of wings!  Someone did mention that they have live music those Wing nights and it gets very loud. She suggested if you want a table further from the band so you can have a conversation to get there well before 8 which is when the band goes on. So 7 PM is a great time, 1 would be better for this night blind old bat.

OH OH I must have missed something ???
http://m.thespec.com/news-story/5251420-life-after-death-10-years-after-the-art-rozendal-murder

A fellow Stelco worker was murdered there by a POS gang banger I can't remember how many years ago. He was an Industrial Mechanic from the lake that lived around the corner. He was having wings with his wife and young son and a so called tough guy gang bangers beat him to death in the hallway when he came to the defence of someone they were bullying. Art Rosenthal. I didn't work with him but it doesn't mater. I will not go there to celebrate anything. I wouldn't go to Dealey Plaza in Dallas to have a picnic either. I'm surprised it still is a bar. For anyone that frequents the place to have fun has no respect for a common good guy that lost his life there for nothing, including the owners. I do not wish them well.  And if you frequent the place Kalvin and know the circumstances, I am surprised, no respect.

John what happened happened, i was not aware it was the same place, but you can not blame the new owners for what happened in the past that was probably out of there knowledge as well.. so we need to stop pointing fingers at the wrong people .John..

I didn't know that was the place, I do remember that incident, was a tragedy. It would give you a weird feeling going in the place. I bet the new owners are always question about the incident. Walking over where a guy that was murdered going to the washroom. I see your feeling John.
Completely different place. The Ale House (formerly Cagney's) is on Upper Gage, not Upper James.
